byline.contributor: Noah Remnick and Eli Rosenberg contributed reporting.
byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and AL BAKER

abstract: New York State Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman's office takes control over inquiry into fatal shooting of Miguel Espinal in Westchester County by New York City Police Officer Garthlette James; is first time Schneiderman's office has taken over investigation of police shooting since Gov Andrew M Cuomo issued executive order in July mandating attorney general to conduct independent reviews of some police shootings of civilians.
lead_paragraph: The Westchester County case is the first big test of an executive order that requires the office of Eric T. Schneiderman to begin independent reviews of certain categories of civilian killings by the police.

headline.main: New York State Attorney General Takes Control of Inquiry Into Fatal Police Shooting
headline.print_headline: Schneiderman Takes Control of Inquiry Into Fatal Police Shooting

snippet: The Westchester County case is the first big test of an executive order that requires the office of Eric T. Schneiderman to begin independent reviews of certain categories of civilian killings by the police.
